immutable_prompts.description: My ultimate goal is to one day build an underwater city, and I am focused on collecting the skills, connecting with people, and understanding the resources necessary to achieve this. I am deeply interested in the multidisciplinary aspects of creating and inhabiting underwater environments. This encompasses robotics for subsea construction and maintenance, the unique challenges of underwater architecture and structural engineering, and innovations in materials science like 3D concrete printing for marine applications. My interests also include the geology of the underwater world, the integration of marine ecosystems (including diverse fish populations) with human-made structures, and the human experience of exploring these environments through scuba diving and freediving. I am keen on learning about seasteading concepts and practical implementations as potential pathways or related endeavors. I'm looking for technical papers, case studies, project proposals, and discussions that contribute to this long-term vision.

mutable_prompts.description:
Current Focus:  Gaining immediate hands-on experience with underwater volcanoes, undersea habitats, underwater robots (especially ROVs), and submersibles, prioritizing US-based opportunities.  Emphasis on joining relevant groups and universities for direct project involvement.

Key Interests: US universities and organizations with ocean engineering programs related to underwater volcanology, undersea habitat design, and ROV operation; relevant meetups and scuba events; opportunities for direct project involvement in building, deploying, or operating underwater robots or submersibles, particularly in volcanic environments.  Specific focus on identifying and joining groups actively involved in underwater habitat design.

Immediate Priorities: Identifying and contacting US universities and organizations offering hands-on experience in underwater robotics, habitat design, or submersible operation; attending relevant meetups and scuba events to network and discover project opportunities; connecting with individuals and groups working with underwater robots, submersibles, and undersea habitats; securing immediate, hands-on project involvement.

Research Priorities: Hands-on experience with ROVs and submersibles; practical applications of underwater robotics in volcanic exploration; design and construction of undersea habitats; identifying key personnel and active research projects at US universities offering immediate, hands-on participation; exploring opportunities to build and deploy ROVs in volcanic environments.  Emphasis on readily accessible avenues for direct project involvement and skill acquisition related to underwater robotics, habitat technologies, and volcanic exploration.
